document.docAuthor: Li, Jian Yong, Liu, Jie & Chen, Jian
document.masterDocTitle: A review of some Neriene spiders (Araneae, Linyphiidae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of some Neriene spiders (Araneae, Linyphiidae) from China

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Neriene marginata
Blackwall, 1833 : 188
(Df)
; Blackwall, 1834b: 363, pl. 3, f. 6–7 (f, Dm).

Linyphia multiguttata
Wider, 1834 : 248
, pl. 17, f. 6 (Dmf); C. L. Koch, 1845: 111, f.1037 (f); Blackwall, 1864a: 249, pl. 17, f. 167 (mf).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Linyphia luctuosa C. L. Koch, 1837: 10
.; Walckenaer, 1841: 271 (Df).

Linyphia pallipes Lucas, 1846: 255
(D; nomen dubium per Roewer, 1955c: 1545).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Linyphia waldea
Chamberlin & Ivie, 1943 : 27
(name for specimens identified by Emerton, 1882 as Linyphia clathrata ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined.
Hubei :
Luotian County ,
Tiantangzai National Forest Park
, 31.11°N , 115.73°E ,
946m
,
26.ix.2009
, X. Xu & H.J. Xie leg., 1M ( CBEE );
Liaoning :
Fushun City , Qingyuan County , Dasuhe Town , Great lake ecological Station , 41.85°N , 124.94°E ,
529m
,
31.vii.2007
, Y.F. Tong leg., 1M and 3FF ( SYNU )
.

Diagnosis: This species is very similar to
Neriene furtiva (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1871)
. These two species can be distinguished from other
Neriene
species by the following combined characters: rather simple paracymbium without branches distally, distal suprategular apophysis with hook-shaped tip of dorsal arm but without membranous ventral tip, terminal apophysis with slightly more than three coils, semicircular atrium opening ( Figs 18–19 , 20 C–E). This species can be distinguished from
N. furtiva
by the following characters: 1, the embolus with small rounded appendage distally of spermduct-tooth
N. clathrata
( Figs 18F , 19E ), but with large appendage in
N. furtiva (Van Helsdingen, 1969 )
; 2, the tip of terminal apophysis with many lappets in
N. clathrata
( Figs 18E , 19D ), but not in
N. furtiva (Van Helsdingen, 1969 )
; 3, the tegulum conspicuously tapering to a point anteriorly in
N. furtiva (Van Helsdingen, 1969 )
, but not conspicuous in
N. clathrata
( Figs 18C , 19 B–C); 4, the atrium opening small in
N. clathrata
compared with
N. furtiva
( Figs 18D, 18G , 20 C–D); 5, the dorsal wall of vulva not prolonged into a parmula, posterior margin nearly straight in
N. clathrata
( Figs 18H , 20E ), but not in
N. furtiva (Van Helsdingen, 1969 )
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 7.
Neriene aquilirostralis Chen & Zhu, 1989
, drawings based on specimens from Tiantangzai National Forest Park, Hubei. A, Pedipalp, prolateral. B, Suprategulum, retrolateral. C, Pedipalp, retrolateral. D, Epigynum, ventral. E, Embolus, retrolateral. F, Terminal apophysis, retrolateral. G–H, Epigynum, cleared. G, Ventral. H, Dorsal. Scale bars, 0.2 mm.

FIGURE 8.
Neriene aquilirostralis Chen & Zhu, 1989
, photos based on male specimen from Tiantangzai National Forest Park, Hubei. A–C, Pedipalp. A, Prolateral. B, Retrolateral. C, Ventral. D, Suprategulum, retrolateral. E, Terminal apophysis, retrolateral. F, Embolus, retrolateral. Scale bars, 0.2 mm.

FIGURE 9.
Neriene aquilirostralis Chen & Zhu, 1989
, photos based on specimens from Tiantangzai National Forest Park, Hubei. A, Female habitus, dorsal. B, Male habitus, dorsal. C–E, Epigynum. C, Ventral, on the body. D, Ventral, cleared, white arrow indicating the start of copulatory goove. E, Dorsal, cleared. Scale bars, A, B, 1 mm; C, D, E, 0.2 mm.

FIGURE 10.
Neriene birmanica (Thorell, 1887)
, drawings based on specimens from Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture, Yunnan. A–B, Pedipalp. A, Prolateral. B, Retrolateral. C, Epigynum, ventral. D, Embolus, retrolateral. E, Terminal apophysis, retrolateral. F, Suprategulum, retrolateral. G–H, Epigynum, cleared. G, Ventral. H, Dorsal. Scale bars, 0.1 mm.

FIGURE 11.
Neriene birmanica (Thorell, 1887)
, photos based on male specimen from Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture, Yunnan. A–C, Pedipalp. A, Prolateral. B, Retrolateral. C, Ventral. D, Terminal apophysis, retrolateral. E, Suprategulum, retrolateral. F, Embolus, retrolateral. Scale bars, 0.1 mm.

FIGURE 12.
Neriene birmanica (Thorell, 1887)
, photos based on specimens from Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture, Yunnan. A, Female habitus, dorsal. B, Male habitus, dorsal. C–E, Epigynum. C, Ventral. D, Ventral, cleared, white arrow indicating the start of copulatory goove. E, Dorsal, cleared. Scale bars, A, B, 1 mm; C, D, E, 0.2 mm.

FIGURE 13.
Neriene calozonata Chen & Zhu, 1989
, drawings based on specimen from Yanzidong Cave, Shennongjia Forestry District, Hubei. A–B, Epigynum, cleared. A, Ventral. B, Dorsal. Scale bars, 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description: See Van Helsdingen (1969) . Distribution: China ( Jilin , Hebei , Jiangxi , Liaoning , Yunnan , Heilongjiang , Shanxi , Gansu , Anhui , Hubei , Guizhou ); Japan ; North Korea ; Europe; Siberia; North America ( Fig. 69 ).
